intro: Gilia campylantha, commonly known as the desert gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy soils and along dry streambeds. Gilia campylantha is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
